attributes.action: Climate change should have a mandatory headline & link on news websites
attributes.additional_details:
On October 8th, 2018, many news sites carried a story from the IPCC explaining the catastrophic consequences facing Earth if climate change is not challenged.

Tomorrow, this news story will be gone and replaced by a wealth of new and relevant stories, but a lot of non-entities too.

This petition challenges the UK Government to implement a mandatory news headline policy on the landing pages of many news, current affairs, sports and entertainment sites as a bid to raise awareness of what is now a permanent threat.

Press releases, fact sheets, scientific articles could all be used to draw source information to keep the issue current, relevant and to raise awareness.
attributes.background:
Climate change can never be old news.

Every middle to top-tier news, current affairs or entertainment site should have a periodic headline focused on climate change, or the need to challenge it.

rejection.details:
We cannot accept petitions about matters which are not the responsibility of Government or Parliament. 

The Government and Parliament are not responsible for headlines chosen by news websites. 

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you'd like the Government and Parliament to do. For example, you could start a new petition asking the Government to fund an awareness campaign about climate change, including advertising on news websites, if that's what you'd like to happen.
